elements.title: St. Mary's Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that parishioners collected the stones used to build St. Mary's Church (pictured) from the iron mines where they worked?

elements.title: Lucy Salani (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lucy Salani is considered the only known Italian transgender person to survive the Nazi concentration camps?

elements.title: Hogwarts Legacy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the early-access period of Hogwarts Legacy, the game set a new record on Twitch with the largest number of concurrent viewers for a single-player game in history?

elements.title: In the Best of Families (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the miniseries In the Best of Families was based on the book Bitter Blood which in turn is a recount of the real life murders of Fritz Klenner?

elements.title: blue-bellied limias (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that male blue-bellied limias spend more than 26 minutes per hour courting females?

elements.title: Arthur Dantchik (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that two Americans, Jeff Yass and Arthur Dantchik, are large funders of the Kohelet Policy Forum, an intellectual driving force of the controversial 2023 Israeli judicial reform package?

elements.title: a Houston TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Houston TV station lost its broadcasting tower in a construction accident a month after going on the air?

elements.title: 2022 NCAA Beach Volleyball Championship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the USC Trojans team that won the 2022 NCAA Beach Volleyball Championship had been compared to the Marvel Comics' Avengers?
